channel.title: Joins on Minjun Jeon

item.title: SQL 8. Joins
item.description:
JOIN is used to combine information from multiple tables in one query. There are four types of JOINs: INNER JOIN, OUTER JOIN, LEFT JOIN, and RIGHT JOIN. When combining two tables, you need one common column, so called reference column or join column.

1. INNER JOIN

INNER JOIN combines two tables only for the rows where the value in the join column occurs in both tables.

If there are m matching rows in the first table and n matching rows in the second table for the join column value, the result will contain m Ã— n rows for that value.
